qas.question: Greece was split into sections of different rulers in what year?
Constantinople once again became a capital  in what year?
The Grecian islands in the 14th century were under the control of who?
In 1261 Constantinople was the capital for which empire?

context: Following the Fourth Crusade and the fall of Constantinople to the "Latins" in <a0_0>1204<a0_0/> mainland Greece was split between the Greek Despotate of Epirus (a Byzantine successor state) and Frankish rule (known as the Frankokratia), while some islands came under Venetian rule. The re-establishment of the <a3_0>Byzantine<a3_0/> imperial capital in Constantinople in <a1_0>1261<a1_0/> was accompanied by the empire's recovery of much of the Greek peninsula, although the Frankish Principality of Achaea in the Peloponnese and the rival Greek Despotate of Epirus in the north both remained important regional powers into the 14th century, while the islands remained largely under <a2_0>Genoese and Venetian<a2_0/> control.
